There is a small sidestreet in the suburbs of Riga, the capital of Latvia. It is no more than 800 metres long. In the town centre at the monument of freedom the supporters of GorbachovÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s policy are having a heated argument with the sympathisers of yesterdayÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s reality. In front of the procuratorÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s office and government buildings pickets are protesting against the injustice and malpractice that has been committed. They demand immediate adaptation of new human laws. The people living in this street do not seem to be involved in political life, yet, is it really so? Ã¢â‚¬Å“We thought that in this street an attentive and unpatient observer who is not too uppish to look into the lives of the seemingly common people without declarations and mass rallies would see something of the contradictory and dramatic fate of the Latvian peopleÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ - This is what the script writer says about the characters of his documentary. He has spent his childhood in this street.
